longDef.en: used especially in questions as the subject or object of a verb, when asking which person or people, or when asking what someone's name is

examples.en: She asked me if I knew who had got the job.
examples.cn: 她问我是否知道谁获得了那份工作。

examples.en: Who (also formal whom) do you want to talk to?
I don't know who to ask to the party.
examples.cn: 我不知道该邀请谁参加聚会。

longDef.en: used with verbs that relate to knowing, when you want to say that something is not known
longDef.cn: （与表示“知道”的动词连用，表示不知道）

examples.en: "Are they going to get married?" "Who knows?" (= It is not possible to know at the moment.)
examples.cn: “他们是要结婚了吗？”“谁知道呢。”

examples.en: Who can tell what will happen now?

longDef.en: used as the subject or object of a verb to show which person you are referring to, or to add information about a person just mentioned. It is used for people, not things
longDef.cn: （用作动词的主语或宾语，表示所提及的人，或附加所提及的人的信息）

examples.en: I think it was your dad who phoned.
examples.cn: 我觉得打电话的人是你爸爸。

examples.en: She's one of those people who love to be the centre of attention.
examples.cn: 她是那种喜欢引人注意的人。

examples.en: He called James, who was a good friend as well as the family doctor.
examples.cn: 他打电话给詹姆斯，詹姆斯既是家庭医生又是他的好朋友。

examples.en: The other people who (also that) live in the house are really friendly.
examples.cn: 住在这所房子里的其他人十分友好。

examples.en: This is Gabriel, who I told you about.
examples.cn: 这是加布里埃尔，我跟你说起过他。

longDef.en:
abbreviation for
the World Health Organization
longDef.cn: 世界卫生组织（the World Health Organization的缩写）
